Tabulate MTD selection frequency

Source: R/visual-summaryTables.R
tabulate_MTD.Rd

Calculates the percentage of simulations where each dose combination is identified as the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) or Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D).

tabulate_MTD(simulation_results, nrow, ncol, type = "RP2D")

Arguments

simulation_results

A list of simulation result objects, each containing either an 'RP2D' element (single value) or an 'MTD' element (possibly multiple values)

nrow

Integer specifying the number of rows in the dose matrix (typically the number of levels for drug A)

ncol

Integer specifying the number of columns in the dose matrix (typically the number of levels for drug B)

type

Character string indicating the type of analysis to perform:

  • "RP2D": Analyze the Recommended Phase 2 Dose selections (default)

  • "MTD": Analyze the Maximum Tolerated Dose selections (may include multiple values per simulation)

Value

A matrix of selection percentages, with dimensions nrow × ncol, where each cell represents the percentage of simulations that identified the corresponding dose combination as the MTD or RP2D

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Assuming simulation_results is a list of simulation outputs
# For a 3x4 dose combination matrix (drug A has 3 levels, drug B has 4 levels)
selection_matrix <- tabulate_MTD(simulation_results, nrow = 3, ncol = 4)

# For MTD analysis instead of RP2D
mtd_matrix <- tabulate_MTD(simulation_results, nrow = 3, ncol = 4, type = "MTD")
} # }
